questions.question: What is AN0M ARCHIVES?
questions.answer: AN0M ARCHIVES is an immersive community experience inspired by the Destiny 2 universe. The project combines <mark>ARG</mark> (Alternate Reality Game), puzzles, and <mark>fragment</mark> hunts to reveal secrets hidden within a <mark>simulated network</mark>.

questions.question: Is this project official?
questions.answer: No. AN0M ARCHIVES is an <mark>independent, community-driven</mark> project created by Destiny 2 enthusiasts. It is <mark>neither affiliated with nor endorsed</mark> by Bungie Inc.

questions.question: What is the project's objective?
questions.answer: To involve players in encrypted narrative exploration: solve <mark>puzzles</mark>, unlock <mark>fragments</mark>, reconstruct <mark>banners</mark>, and discover the secrets of the AN0M network.

questions.question: On which platforms is it available?
questions.answer: The experience is accessible via a <mark>modern web browser</mark> on computer or mobile. <mark>No installation required</mark>.

questions.question: What does "fragment" mean in the AN0M system?
questions.answer: A <mark>fragment</mark> is a portion of code that players unlock by solving a puzzle. Multiple combined fragments allow you to reconstruct a <mark>banner</mark>, symbol of a complete secret.

questions.question: Why do I need to log in with my Bungie account?
questions.answer: Logging in via <mark>Bungie OAuth2</mark> allows us to link your progress to your Guardian profile and ensure the legitimacy of your participation. <mark>No external actions</mark> are performed on your Bungie account.

questions.question: Do I need to know Destiny 2 lore?
questions.answer: No, but knowing it will make the experience richer. Puzzles and clues often reference lore elements, <mark>but it's not blocking</mark>.

questions.question: How can I follow news and updates?
questions.answer: Major updates are announced on our official channels: <mark>Twitter/X</mark> → @anom_archives, <mark>Discord</mark> (coming soon), <mark>News</mark> section on the site.

questions.question: How do the puzzles work?
questions.answer: Each <mark>banner</mark> is composed of multiple <mark>fragments</mark>. To obtain them, you must enter <mark>codes</mark>, solve text or visual puzzles, and submit the correct answer.

questions.question: What happens when I enter a code?
questions.answer: The <mark>terminal</mark> verifies its validity. If correct, it opens an <mark>immersive section</mark> containing <mark>encrypted text</mark>, clues, or a puzzle. Solving it leads to unlocking a fragment.

questions.question: A code isn't working, what should I do?
questions.answer: Check that it's complete and correctly entered (<mark>uppercase/lowercase</mark>, <mark>hyphens</mark>). If the problem persists, check the <mark>Known Bugs</mark> section of the news or contact support.

questions.question: What are unlocked fragments used for?
questions.answer: Each fragment corresponds to a part of a <mark>final code</mark>. Once all fragments of a banner are obtained, you unlock the associated <mark>reward or secret</mark>.

questions.question: Can I replay a puzzle I've already solved?
questions.answer: Yes, but it will remain <mark>marked as completed</mark>. You can revisit its content to review clues or narrative.

questions.question: What's the difference between a "Simple" and "Hard" challenge?
questions.answer: <mark>SIMPLE</mark> → 3 fragments to unlock in the same banner. <mark>HARD</mark> → 1 single fragment, often more complex and narrative-driven.

questions.question: Are there real rewards?
questions.answer: <mark>No</mark>, rewards are <mark>digital, symbolic, or community-based</mark>: exclusive banners, public recognition, hidden codes, etc.

questions.question: How does Bungie login work?
questions.answer: The site uses the <mark>official OAuth2 protocol</mark> from Bungie.net. This only authorizes reading <mark>public information</mark> from your profile (displayName, membershipId...).

questions.question: Is my data secure?
questions.answer: Yes. Information is stored securely using <mark>JWT and encrypted cookies</mark>. <mark>No sensitive data</mark> (email, password) is retained.

questions.question: Is my information public?
questions.answer: Only your <mark>Bungie username</mark> can appear in leaderboards or public pages. You can choose to <mark>hide your progress</mark>.

questions.question: Can I delete my account or data?
questions.answer: Yes. A deletion request can be sent via the Support page. All your data (progress, fragments, history) will be <mark>permanently deleted</mark>.

questions.question: What is an "influencer" in AN0M?
questions.answer: Influencers are partner creators with a <mark>dedicated panel</mark> to create events, puzzles, and <mark>exclusive banners</mark> for their community.

questions.question: How do I participate in a community event?
questions.answer: Each event has an <mark>exclusive link</mark>. Simply log in with your Bungie account to access it and follow the terminal instructions.

questions.question: Can I stream or create content?
questions.answer: <mark>Yes!</mark> The project encourages content creation, whether streaming, videos, or community decryption. Please <mark>credit AN0M ARCHIVES</mark> and include a link to the site.

questions.question: Is there a public leaderboard?
questions.answer: Yes. The <mark>leaderboard</mark> displays players who have completed the most fragments or banners. Updates are in <mark>real-time</mark>.

questions.question: Can I solve puzzles with others?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Some banners are designed for <mark>cooperation</mark> and <mark>sharing clues</mark> between players.

questions.question: Does the site work on mobile?
questions.answer: Yes. The interface is <mark>responsive</mark> and optimized for mobile and tablet devices.

questions.question: I have a bug or code error. What should I do?
questions.answer: Reload the page. Check your connection. If the problem persists, <mark>contact support</mark> or report it via Discord.

questions.question: What's the technical stack?
questions.answer: Frontend: <mark>Next.js 14, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, Shadcn UI</mark>. Backend: <mark>Node.js, Express.js, TypeScript</mark>. Database: <mark>MongoDB</mark>. Auth: <mark>BetterAuth + OAuth2 Bungie</mark>.

questions.question: Can I contribute to development?
questions.answer: Not at the moment. The code is <mark>not open-source</mark>, but community extensions will be considered later.

questions.question: Why so many references to Vex and simulation?
questions.answer: The Vex represent <mark>algorithmic perfection</mark> and time manipulation. AN0M ARCHIVES draws inspiration from this to create a cryptic atmosphere around the notion of <mark>simulated reality</mark>.

questions.question: Do fragments have hidden meanings?
questions.answer: <mark>Yes</mark>. Each fragment contributes to a larger <mark>narrative whole</mark>. Some form phrases or symbolic codes linked to the network's story.

questions.question: What do the encrypted messages mean?
questions.answer: They represent <mark>internal communications</mark> of the AN0M network and Vex language. Some messages are purely decorative, others hide <mark>real clues</mark>.

questions.question: Is there an end to the experience?
questions.answer: Each banner cycle constitutes a <mark>"season"</mark>. Once all banners of a season are completed, a <mark>new narrative arc</mark> begins.
